JI5GQDGr-2-iF1uQuRrpkg.text: Rooftop view of St Paul's ? What's not to like. Drinks are a bit more expensive then a regular pub but worth it. It needs to be a nice sunny day to go because you want to be outside on the rooftop.

wALeLPY-ZqcK0028XX5iSQ.text: Upstairs and outdoors.  Views great. Very busy on a Friday night, seems popular with leaving do's/work drinks. The seating arrangement isn't the most welcoming, but you can't blame them for the lack of space.  I think there is table service but no point waiting.  Big gripe was the warm bottled beer.  Is so busy that the turnover of beers is rapid and the fridge is being refilled constantly so they never get a chance to get cold, but then invest in bigger fridges and put them out back.

uhly2mFbheR5N4LUt7kMkw.text: This place is awesome! Went here for my birthday. The night was cold,but it was so nice under the warmth of the heatlamps and deliciously prepared drinks. Obviously, the view of St. Pauls and London is just phenomenal. It is never too crowded and it is the best place to grab a drink after a long workday. Food is solid as well and the staff is always willing to help out.

GHwb3WyTgSK5c29h2Gt3mQ.text: The outdoor view is really adorable and one of a kind especially during night time

TQyQNpSbzZ5G1IMTZPhlGQ.text: Ahhh! London summer nights & Madison Rooftop Bar = PERFECTION! If nothing else, order the Pornstar Martinis. They are DELICIOUS! I could easily drink 4 glasses and not realize I'm tipsy because it's THAT GOOD.

wdnxphYMbeS2kG0wk_BwVA.text: Rooftop Bar and Trendy place full of city professionals. The cocktail bar is good, but overall nothing special on this place + it's a bit pricey. Main reason to come here is for the view which is really impressive. Would suggest as a place to get a quick drink before you go for food on a date.

-CXf_Rx8ucuzMgFpKtwFLw.text: 4* for the view, but I'd only give 3* for bar service. I would only ever visit here for the rooftop view of St Paul's, as it gets so ridiculously crowded it's usually impossible to even find a space to stand with your drinks!

tlZy2i5wDi0AIzZcQ7rhvQ.text: The one thing you can't complain about is the view. It's pretty awe-inspiring and the food and drink were great. Unfortunately, that's where the lack of complaints end. I can only fathom that the view is what is keeping the bar busy, because the attitude of the staff bordered on the downright criminal. A dropped plate at our table, before any of the meal was eaten, caused a disagreement over our bill. The manager insisted that we had been given a 'replacement' meal (which we had been offered, not requested) which was then included on the bill, bringing the cost of one plate of fish and chips to £32 and leading me to believe that the word 'replacement' doesn't mean what they think it means.This was clearly a misunderstanding and an opportunity for Madison to show some good customer service, the 'customer is always right' if you will. We weren't trying to take advantage and claim free stuff, but if there is ever a small disagreement, you'd imagine that the customers viewpoint is the one that managers should lean towards believing. Instead this got pretty heated, the waiter branding a member of our group a 'liar' at one point, and was only resolved when we were allowed to remove the service charge, not the meal. The way this was dealt with was pretty despicable - it was an accident and a misunderstanding. We were not looking for a freebie (the first meal hadn't been touched!) but we did expect a minimum standard of customer service that we didn't receive.Somehow, don't think we'll be going back. Though I suppose we might go up to the free viewing platform next to the bar just for that view.

ouj84jsi8cIVroehgqdg8g.text: Great place to hit up after work when the sun's out. Drinks aren't cheap, but what a view of St. Paul's Cathedral from the terrace! Makes you appreciate London in all it's glory.

7fevgOqa0PCPmPJ9n4D5ZA.text: My godness, I have experienced a lot better.1. Yes, the outdoor space and the views are amazing. But of course if you want a table outside or an area outside, you have to pay top £.2. Insanely crowded on a Thursday night.3. Food is pretty much bleh. Mediocre. Do not go here for a fancy dinner. go here for drinks. I wouldn't ever go again on a Thursday or Friday night. I think I would attempt to go for a drink on a Monday or so.4. Service on a busy night wasn't great either.Overall, if they wouldn't have the outdoor space, they probably wouldn't be in business anymore based on service and food.Indoor space is lovely too, but again, food is bleh.

eyBroBzRQFhSgCCABwXFbw.text: One of the best locations in London in the summer. Enjoying a post work cocktail on the terrace overlooking St Paul's on a nice day is not a bad way to spend an evening. Food from the restaurant is good and so is the tapas outside.

yvPIY2BAWTnaowLL28iNTQ.text: Great view. Nice selection of entrés. Mains a bit heavy compared to entrés but comforting.

zlrV-ONsjld9-5n_apDF1g.text: Awesome views!! You pay slightly more for this view of St Pauls but it is worth it. Great date venue!

iIZpy8vMz7sNbA7MWwyqCA.text: Great spot for after-work drinks, the view of St Pauls at sunset is not to be missed.Cocktails were very good, if a little pricy. It was quite crowded when I was there, yet I didn't have a problem getting drinks, so props to the bar staff.Downsides: Only beer they serve is HeinikenMinimal seatingCan't take drinks outside the bar area (ie to get a better view of St Pauls)

haCVkHAcoQt1emUFXTR9tg.text: The space is great, and the drinks aren't (too) overpriced. The meat-market aspects and crowd knock it down a star or two, but the view of St Pauls pulls it up at least one. If you're looking for a drink outdoors, perhaps with out-of-towners, and if you're in the neighbo(u)rhood anyway, it's not half bad.

Gdh5cUhVpsvj-vqbjZgP0Q.text: Great food and their night life events are great! We came here in the winter and they had blankets outside in the seating areas so you could catch in the scenery of the cathedral or have a smoke. A really great place to go when your in London. Only drawbacks I had were when they are open as a night club the food seating area isnt moved around to generate more floor space in the summer this isnt really a problem cause can hangout outside but in the winter it is freezing and you are stuck shoulder to shoulder with everyone here. I came here a second time for dinner and although pricey everything was delicious from the mac and cheese to the burgers and everything else inbetween. Great date place!

zhcEUa88xglfSuM0VljaXg.text: Madisons London is situated on top of One New Change, the newest shopping venue in London, opposite St. Paul's Cathedral, with views to make most building jealous.  By 6pm it was wriggling with life, and atmosphere despite the typical English grey clouds looming above.Seated under a glass canopy so the views are far from hidden an extensive cocktail list was placed in front of me, and it was all too hard to choose.  Being won over by The Melted Strawberry consisting of Grey Goose vodka, strawberry and apple juice I began to muse over the delights on the food menu, deciding that three courses were more than needed as there was too many tasty dishes to pick from.Having the delicious Jamon Pata Negra for starter certainly pleased my palette, making it excited for what was to follow, with flavours my taste buds had never experienced before.  The bread was toasted to perfection and the jamon melted within my mouth.  My partner in crime had Croquetas Pata Negra, which, so I'm told, was as equally as tasty.After a jamon filled set of starters, it was time to set my appetite to rest with a divine Spaghetti Vongole, which was displayed so nicely it was a shame to have to stick my fork in!  The Madison Burger consumed by the fore mentioned partner in crime was juicy, and cooked just as he likes it.  Certainly nothing to complain about here!And wow, the deserts were something to write home about, not that the previous courses weren't. Obviously!  Having an ice cream sundae to knock the socks off most that I have eaten before, and trying the Petit Pot Au Chocolat finished the meal with the same great flavours as it began with.

vwdpwXV8mV0RK8T58XMT5Q.text: Great Rooftop Bar with an amazing view of St Paul's Cathedral. I've been here quite a few times now usually walking towards the river or the Tate Modern and I suddenly remember there is a place that offers a free view of the city! Yes, thats right, you can come to the 6th floor of 1 New Change without paying at all. Of course it is great to sit with a drink in the sun and soak up the atmosphere but don't feel obliged to, I've seen many people come up and take a seat and some photos and then leave without security or the bar staff ever approaching them. Perfect for a Saturday night pre-drink or a lazy Sunday afternoon.

n77MzuOaKutW44aO7WTEhg.text: Great location and thats why it gets 4 stars. Can sit on their settees on the roof terrace and sip your drinks while looking at the amazing view of St Pauls dome within touching distance. Great when the weather is good. Unfortunately lots of visitors constantly coming to  the viewing area makes it hard to get on the lift.

ma-3SQwZ2S06ANzDWsJmsQ.text: Avoid!! Very disappointing because - bouncers ask people to leave if they are not dressed to their code. Website has no mention of any dress code. I think it was more to do with skin colour :(

9iIor1vRAbevgN_orMmA_Q.text: Madison is a good spot for out-of-towners because it has an unbeatable view of St. Paul's and central London. Coming from NYC, you tend to appreciate rooftop bars in other cities since ours are typically disappointing.  The cocktails are a bit pricey, food was just okay, but the people watching made the experience worthwhile. If you're going for dinner, make a reservation. Went on a Wednesday night and it was packed. If you're going for drinks, good luck snagging a spot by the window.

GxaZCwSVjC9R2Rwwa5O-fQ.text: One of the best views in London, great for cocktails and people watching. As far as the food goes I will have to give it 2 stars, also the service was not the best in the restaurant, they seem to be scrambling a bit. The service at the bar though was much better. Will go back but just for cocktails in the best rooftop in London.

TsF8Hy0kFhzu1_pd5XuObw.text: We had a great time here last night. The space is beautiful and the outdoor bar has a very cosy feel with booths, cushioned chairs, and a standing area. I wish they didn't have the top sections of the windows frosted. It blocks some of the beautiful view of St. Paul's and the London. It also was quite noisy when the lounge area was full.  The food was good and not too expensive- compared to other similar options around The City. I had the pork chop which comes with macaroni and cheese. That was delicious! My husband had the burger, and his associate had the rib-eye. The chips are thin cut and crispy, just how we like them. They both started with the scallops which were quite good. This will be a very popular place once everyone realises it's open. We look forward to going back.

ki8rgBhhKDzs5HGjn0cGiA.text: Beautiful setting full of beautiful folks. I was so mesmerized by the atmosphere I can't actually remember if the drinks were good.  One of my favorite places in London.

zLU9AosvTLQUR48Abo4TeA.text: Stunning view of St. Paul's! There wasn't a queue when I got here but slowly grew after 6 pm. I recommend getting here a bit early to grab a table. Drinks weren't overpriced for the area. Great atmosphere and the view is to worth it!

znkIyx8IPRA0sEvFJU9Lng.text: Nice lounge place to hangout and have drinks; good views of St. Paul's from the top deck; food is just okay; I had the Jerusalem artichoke soup, Cornish chicken and cake. Soup had confusing tastes (didn't know what to make of it). Cornish hen along and fries were decent. We were a large group. The serving staff seem to forget whom to serve after getting their orders. Bottom line: I wouldn't come here for the food.

uiYvkhnH4uF56mHpImT4yA.text: Fantastic view, drinks were great, but the female barmaid was hostile and didn't want to take our second order. We left promptly after that. Normally the staff is great, but one bad apple spoils the bunch. It can be very busy after work if the sun is out and makes it less enjoyable as well. I like to go when its not raining (as its all outside the the inside part is not as nice) but is slightly cold out and then there is no one there and the service is lovely. My favorite drink is the Secret Garden, its gin and cucumber muddled together with rosemary. Very refreshing.

KUkipMlidYiVAbvvnkL_cQ.text: Great location!! Its worth a visit here even if only for an amazing view across London and St Pauls. Very much a post work place and always mobbed in the evenings especially a Friday. It was a lovely evening so we pitched ourselves outside to get a better view. Although it was cold most of the seats have overhead heaters which aren't always turned on so make sure you ask them to switch it on.They have a large supply on designer beers (probably so they can charge you more) and the only beer they have on tap is Heineken which on the night we were there they had none!!Its pricey and the staff aren't the cheeriest of people. Come on guys, with the price of those drinks and the awesome surroundings the least you can do is give us a smile!

photos.caption: Photo of Madison - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Madison - London, United Kingdom

u3WKjWdZp1Aq6JDVAPnfIw.text: I've been to Madison a few times and I'm decidedly mixed. If you want to eat here, make a reservation. Simple as that. If you like mixed drinks, they do a good job. They're a bit pricey, but it comes with the location. When I've been out with friends and all we wanted were some drinks, this worked out well. When I wanted to eat, I discovered I really should have booked. Oh well. And when I went out with some beer drinkers, I found the bar had no interesting beers at all. I think it was Heineken on tap and some unremarkable stuff in bottles.So I still take tourists here because the views are amazing. But we often spend more time elsewhere. Maybe having a round or two here and then moving on. Definitely worth a stop once, but not necessarily the kind of place I'd frequent.

RGqLD3iMwS9ofesPyT1OwQ.text: I went to Maddison Bar last night with my friend for her birthday cocktails. The first thing that shocked me was the amount of people crammed into the area! Expecting it to busy as the sun was shining I wasn't prepared to be sardined in. Saying this the queue to the bar wasn't long at all, and the cocktails were amazing (albeit a tad expensive!). The Pornstar Martini was the best by far. The view from the bar however was lovely, looking out onto London and right next to St Paul's it really does make a nice atmosphere for after work drinks. I would recommend this place but make sure you get there early to grab a space!

_mz1kGUXf8UD9RQxhyt2dw.text: Rooftop bar. Great views, awful drinks. Worst mojito I've ever had in my life. Not much seating, but definitely worth it just for the location. You feel like you're on top of the world.

4O35oaJRnUeRDV1Zbrk5Sg.text: There's no denying that the views are pretty extraordinary, especially at sunset.However, Madison is what I would think of as a tourist's idea of where COOL HIP LONDONERS go to hang out and be cool and hip. The drinks are ok (but kind of pricey for the variety you're getting) and the tapas aren't much better. The crowd is very mixed depending on the day and there's a minimum spend for reservations.Be warned, trying to get here after work on a Thursday when the weather is nice is like trying to invade Greece at the battle of Thermopylae. Hoards of people are squeezed into the glassbox elevator, made to ferment in the ride up to the roof and then stuffed again into a tightly rope-curtained standing area diligently patrolled by security personnel. Guess this is Sparta.

iQcmSM_tCTjrIS_LQcKcOg.text: On those rare days the sun does shine down on London, I will be at Madison. Who knew that a top the ugly brown One New Change building there is a sun-bathing gem of a restaurant and bar?! As we exited the elevator on the roof, I felt I was walking into an exclusive club; but the area could not be more accommodating. The cocktails were a little pricey (the cheapest being £8-9), but they were very inventive and tasty. I especially recommend the Passion Fruit Mojito. I didn't eat, but the tapas bar outside or the restaurant inside looked inviting. I will definitely be eating next time. The outdoor seating is stocked with comfy chairs and tables. If you can't snag a seat though, the deck has ample area for mingling and admiring the gorgeous view of St Pauls. Too bad other buildings below block the Thames and other famous London sites, but nevertheless, it's a great place to sunbathe all day and admire the sunset in the evening.

photos.caption: Photo of Madison - London, United Kingdom. Madison on top of London

6UVcDdVtbZ4F0vRHULkj3Q.text: I always bring out-of-town visitors here for the view - and if we're lucky a drink at the bar (it's always super busy and packed when the weather is nice). Cocktails are a bit pricey, but the beers weren't too outrageous. If it's a weekday and it's nice out, it'll definitely be packed - get there a little early and you'll be fine. Really it's the view that makes you want to go back - service can be hit and miss, there's often long lines to get to the bar, and prepare to spend more than you do at other bars.

Zm4iiPSPWGVDIOoMEZ3SSA.text: Service was a little slow for us, but we enjoyed a good tasting meal and some cocktails. The view of the Cathedral really cannot be beat.

-kghB0R2-CBnrO2Ihe0hpA.text: I frequent Madisons regularly because I'm lucky enough to work in the building so I never have to queue to get it via the glass elevator, I've seen how long the queues were in summer, very very long!The drinks are on the more expensive side. If you like cocktails you are in the right place. Great Pornstar Martinis and the Long Island Ice Teas are amazing but tread carefully, they are very strong! :)Beer is on the pricey side too but similar to the pubs in the area that charge pretty much the same prices but without the gorgeous location. Service is dependant on how busy it is. It's only natural for service to not be as good when it gets really busy but overall the times I've not been happy with the service have been rare.In the summer it gets very very busy, too busy for some. The bar gets very busy but they have waiters and waitresses walking around taking orders too. Now that it's cooling down it doesn't get as busy but don't hang about if you want to get a seat with your mates.

xuiPGp9aDQmUL_QIAXsuzQ.text: I guess you pay for the atmosphere here. 6 quid for a gin and tonic, and it seems very hip to go there after work, especially on a Friday night. The place was packed when we arrived at 7pm. We managed to nab a table as soon as another group left, but no seating at all. It was so loud, I was shouting the whole time. Took forever to get a drink, but the plus side was the beautiful view of the city at night, and right next door to St. Paul's Cathedral, also a lovely view.

3q5wANkwExVXdYKkoUmuXg.text: I love when places in London are described as "Modern European." Modern European is not the same as Modern British, just to be clear. Modern European is ear-blastingly loud remixes and long queues for basic cocktails. Modern British is St. Paul's over your shoulder as you chat with friends. Technically, then, Madison is both.The view, as all say, is why you're here. Pop in early with friends, don't mind the queue as it moves quickly, and get cozy to enjoy the nice weather. There are few places that are as iconic as Madison, but the drinks are expensive and not that strong for what you're paying.Definitely a 'must-do' experience, though I'm not sure for more than one 'must-doing'.

tO1CCCpkMkO1rB4p4OVWhw.text: I learnt, that you cannot expect a place to be cheap if it's in the heart of the City and has a rooftop terrace. It's priced for the location and yes I do realise that £11 for double vodka soda is excessive, but there is no cover charge and stunning view of St Pauls sort of makes up for it.The service at the bar was quick, though I was terrified when I first saw the queues. Waiters, waitresses and bartenders were all nice and polite - which is a very good for a place that could potentially have the most rude staff ever and still attract people (I avoid such places at all costs).On a Friday afternoon with a light breeze from the passing summer - I would definitely come back and enjoy my expensive drink and probably meet like-minded people as well.The only downside is their closing time. They advertise themselves as 'open till late' but they really are not. After my friend and I had a quick bite at Burger & Lobster and came back for more drinks at around 11.30pm, we weren't let in, justified by the fact that the place is closing. And it was during the summer heatwave. Come on, Madison!

s2KM4B0AqhqzlKVp4z70CA.text: Food - the food was sub par. The sea bass was dry. The burgers were not that flavored. Everything was just ok. Service - slow slow service. However, the views are amazing.

V12gbXpkKs_gYOfOunj-TA.text: Slightly different atmosphere. Lots of old men with young women (whatever floats your boat) *cough* goldiggers. I had a burger with fries and a side of mac n cheese. Very yummy! Service was slightly snobby. Beautiful views from the bar.

yi9zNljs8_amwqNc9ywuzg.text: You know you're in a classy joint when there's a £9 drink called Hot Bitch, which packed a punch and was quite fiery (just like I like my hot bitches, yeaaa).  Sure it's a bit expensive with its small portions and big price tags.  But who can beat the incredible evening view of a lit up St. Paul and London Eye?Came here on a Monday night at around 7, and although it was busy, we were easily able to get a table.  The £8.5 Japanese Cooler was a nice juxtapose to the Hot Bitch with its exotic addition of wasabi.Shared a few tapas, which were good but quickly added up.  We all agreed the £7 Popcorn Squid was just as calamari should be (ie not rubbery), the £7 Fish and Chips were served in a cute mini frying basket and tasted as fish should taste (ie not rubbery), and the truffle fries were the consensual favorite (also not rubbery if you were asking).Definitely will come here again, maybe with a fuller wallet next time.

qbYXBs_K-NzM2AejEwIJKw.text: I thought this place was fantastic!  Me and my girlfriends went in for some yummy champagne after dinner and pre dancing and found this place delightful.  We had an amazing view of St Pauls and had a nice couch to sit, drink and enjoy the beautiful view at night.  Yes, its pricey, but its London. What ISNT pricey?!?  I think the only annoying thing was the girls lookin like hookers walking around...this aint no CLUB!  (or maybe im old)I will definitely be back for beautiful views and a chill romantic night with the hubby.  Cant wait for the weather to be consistently good!

E6mSGerH-LNBouLJRcM82A.text: When the sun is shining and the weather is warm, the queue will seem endless - and for good reason. A direct look at St. Paul's and a panoramic view of the skyline will make you forget what you're drinking. Yes, Madison is a restaurant and bar, but the real reason to come here is to soak up the sights and sun. Wine? That's just a bonus.

HsbzqIvpRNCJ-QWcK5HgxQ.text: I've been to Madison twice now and I'm pretty lukewarm about it. The cocktails are heinously expensive, yet not great. Service lacks grace. The view is obviously fantastic and the bar itself is pretty nicely done, the outside area has some comfortable seating and the view of St Paul's Cathedral is probably unmatched by any other bar. The night I went there was a really good DJ although we did ask for the music to be turned down (it later went back up). Worth it for a quick drink staring at the view, but not for a whole evening.

photos.caption: Photo of Madison - London, United Kingdom. Epic view

ssR9ku2G9kYa8Qm4SoKhoQ.text: Quite a good view, best enjoyed in summer- when it is very popular with out-of-towners at the weekend. The food is pretty well executed, but fairly timid. Think a step  up from All Bar One, but not a very big step- burgers and steak , and a little bit of mild exotica ( a well done lamb tagine, for example). Would pass for the best restaurant in a middling size market town somewhere provincial. The staff, in my experience, are numerous and reasonably efficient, although the poor experiences noted by other reviewers probably result from fatigue at serving the oceans of thirsty drunken punters at peak times.

_2ofjPRn0EcgwdyZQy-2mg.text: Incredible views of the cathedral and the thames London especially as the sun sets and the decorative lights of the city come on!What a great place such an eyeopener!Definitely book if you want to sit and eat! Great for after work drinks as well! Can get very busy so arrive early! We did wait in a queue for a drink for about 20 minutes ( on a tuesday) but it was outdoor and on a nice evening it doesn't really matter if your in good company! The food was yum with lots on the menu to suit different tastes! The pate to start was delicious (not everyone's cup of tea i know) The cocktails were fab! The waiter even asked me what type of one i wanted then went to the bar to ask for one to be made up that wasn't on the menu as a treat! Such a lovely setting for an evening. I will definitely go back

photos.caption: Photo of Madison - London, United Kingdom. View from the terrace

phVVzbcij8sGTvirQjV8ww.text: This place has a brilliant views of St. Paul's Cathedral but the service and the crowd a bit too pretentious for my taste. It's worth having a drink to enjoy the view but I prefer a less majestic view with friendlier service and atmosphere.

CrQMVeWZVt9VE3ZCxe-K3g.text: A wonderful location in the city. Great 'afterwork drinks' atmosphere and lovely view of St Paul's Cathedral.  A little tip for you - it gets pretty busy to get the lift to the bar (in the New Change shopping centre) after 7pm. There was a super long queue when I went on a Friday. So, get the escalator to the first floor and catch the lift there (no queue) ;)Well worth a visit if you haven't been

photos.caption: Photo of Madison - London, United Kingdom. Wonderful view!

TEt07nfD7bxROHPsm3anQA.text: Yes this place is expensive and yes it has an amazingly spectacular view of St. Paul's, which is one of the most beautiful monuments in London. If you go during a sunset you will not be disappointed at all. The seating is really well thought out as well. They have heaters everywhere and you can sit out if you wish to. If you are in the mood to splurge and just want to treat yourself to a spectacular view while sipping your drink this would be my recommendation. While I was there, I noticed that they also have indoors seating, where they also serve food. This also has an amazing view of the South bank, London eye area along with the St Pauls dome view. We had a few cocktails, I really liked a cocktail that had clove in it. I forget it's name. Some martini. The drinks were good and the service was attentive and polite.

photos.caption: Photo of Madison - London, United Kingdom. Our table !
Photo of Madison - London, United Kingdom. The view

q3BfZGtjUohedwIiG2sJYQ.text: In my continuing quest to overpay for drinks in London, I find my self displeased with the Madison. Or should I say, pleased that I failed my quest and didn't overpay.Cocktails 10 pounds. Wine from 5 and up.BUT THE VIEW. OH THE VIEW.

Wd9rnvTOtAOM79kQ322fCQ.text: First of all, the view from the rooftop was breathtaking. I loved that there was no entry fee and that the atmosphere was calm. The drinks weren't overly pricey compared to those at Vista (another rooftop venue) and the staff were rather approachable. The only thing I found slightly strange was that no drinks were allowed in the "grassy" area, which was where everyone could best enjoy the view. The place wasn't overly crowded for a Friday night, either. Overall - great experience.

NgqdNqW7-vI65MhmTlJNOw.text: Stunning view, stunning atmosphere and stunning cocktails. A little expensive but definitely worth it. Good after work drinks place. You can sit on the lounges or stand at the bar tables. Also has a restaurant section if you would like a sit down meal. I would like to recommended a chili cocktail with passion fruit infused flavours served in a chilled glass. If you like chili this is the cocktail to go for. It'll wake you up from the punchy freshness flavour and also leave you wanting more!

photos.caption: Photo of Madison - London, United Kingdom. View from the roof!

Ga5I32jeSEaSyv1QF8ZgvA.text: Let's begin with the facts...a) It's expensiveb) It has amazing viewsGlad we got that out of the way. It reminds me of a frou-frou sceney over-priced rooftop bar in Manhattan called 230Fifth. But I still recommend that place to out of towners who like the scene and want to experience it (except there you get red robes in the winter time).Drinks are on the expensive end but try ordering a low-to-mid priced bottle of wine. Saves you some £ and saves you from having to fight crowds on a packed evening to get back to the bar.I will say - this is a prime spot come Friday when it's nice out. Watch the time because there is a queue (and supposed dress code) but it moves.Honestly, I've been here less than a month and been twice. The 2nd time because some out of town visitors suggested it but I really couldn't find it in my heart to say "no, you DON'T want incredible views of St. Pauls and London during sunset...."

gV3lcTKMiG6WdzpBlb6KFQ.text: First off, after several people highly recommended this place, I decided to kill some time here before my flight back to Las Vegas.  If you order anything but alcoholic beverage, expect it not to show up at ALL... Even after pestering for it for over an hour. Mind you I did have 3 cocktails which were immediately brought to me. My favorite cocktail was the Hot Bitch  out of the three I ordered. Spicy and Sweet. The rooftop view on this 6th floor venue gave amazing views of the city especially the nighttime skyline.I even met some amazing people whom I can't wait to catch up with in December on my return.

kjD_ilU3k6dNssqN6e2RsQ.text: Did not manage to eat here yet but will defo be back in the future. Great views of St Pauls and even towards the shard etc.A rooftop bar with a DJ is always a hit with me but the music was good to chill to, still conversate without having to shout.They sell cigars, tapas and an extensive drinks menu.May need to re review once I have a bite to eat though...

photos.caption: Photo of Madison - London, United Kingdom. Great rooftop bar!

dA0F1OQsdmGY5PHq84x-bw.text: Madison is one of my favorite spots in London; there is no other rooftop bar quite like it.  Literally facing St Pauls and overlooking the Shard and the London Eye, it boasts some of the best views of London.  It is extremely spacious outside (yet a small bar inside) with seating and heat lamps for the less forgiving months of the year.  The wine list is varied and the cocktails are sublime.  The restaurant (across from the bar) has a fun, young vibe with a diverse menu.  The food is well-presented and very tasty.  The service is outstanding - waiters are extremely kind, helpful and attentive.I would absolutely go back, especially to enjoy the rooftop bar in the spring and summer!

LtcExq2YZD4oyW_SD4NmTg.text: Love it!  Especially on a Friday afternoon when it is sunny!  Lots of options and even better views!  The crowd is hip and the atmosphere fun.  Definitely a must if you enjoy view over the city...

photos.caption: Photo of Madison - London, United Kingdom. Beat day to be here!

rhWqaOQox_hHwSDuYFlrgw.text: Back in the summer of 2013, Madison's was the place to be in central London, and it's not hard to see why. With a huge, glass-fronted atrium for the rainy days, a spacious roof terrace for the sunny days, and an incredible view of St Paul's all year round, it's one of the best roof top bars you'll find in London.When I visited a few weeks back, I also ate there for the first time with some Texan friends who were visiting London. The food is not cheap, but it is delicious. I had the Mac & Cheese with broccoli, and it was just so tasty. My friends had the lobster roll, which went down a treat, and the chateaubriand, which they also loved.We stayed for drinks afterwards - the bar service isn't the best, but it's not terrible. There's plenty of room inside for a touch of light dancing, and the cocktails are pretty good.The roof terrace does get extremely busy, and you may need to queue to get in for after-work drinks unless you've booked in advance, especially when it's a beautiful sunny day. It's well worth a visit to Madison's, especially if you're with guests from outside of London or have been living under a rock for the last 2 years and haven't yet been yourself!

8sfwHV6dcfGPr95-RKAFqw.text: Came here for a few drinks on a friend's hen do. Fantastic views of the city, plenty of comfy seating outside, with heaters and blankets for when it gets cold... A slight problem in that its beverages somewhat out of my price range., but it's a great place to come for a booze with a view if you've got a little cash to splash.

photos.caption: Photo of Madison - London, United Kingdom. Rooftop views

RRef35gmXE5n89ZQeImtiQ.text: Forget about all the fancy bars in the Shard, this rooftop has a unique perspective on St Pauls Cathedral and it's gorgeous ! Who knew there was such a nice place in this shopping mall ? I didn't, until one of my friend invited me. Trust me, you won't regret it when you go out of the elevator. Don't arrive to late, so you can grab a sit outside (there are blankets for the cold evenings) and enjoy the view. The drinks aren't that expensive for the area and you can order some snacks. If you're lucky enough to have a sit inside, enjoy the view while sitting in a couch : perfect !

pYrKbq_Tr4HteZ-jxVDItQ.text: Drink: Gin and Tonic - HendricksPrice: £7.50Review: Reasonably priced for the location. Avoid large groups as the tables are filled pretty early on in the night. Unfortunately, the people who sit on the tables tend not to migrate to other bars so waiting for a table could be some time! People are well dressed, and the atmosphere is fantastically jubilant when the sun decides to come out in this wonderful city!

photos.caption: Photo of Madison - London, United Kingdom. The view from Madison's

oyTHWeZCtaSKLDBZyo5EYQ.text: Oh I really did want to find my new city bar, and this promised so much, but delivered so little. I turned up at 4pm on a Thursday and it was already crowded. In order to sit at a sofa in the non smoking section, you have to reserve, and a reservation means a minimum 600 quid spend. (Well if you all let them get away with it, what do you expect?) So I perched at a table for two on a high stool. A friend then turned up and found space round the corner in the smoking section, on a sofa, so I decamped round there. There were four of us meeting and we were really interested in catching up and chatting to each other over some interesting cocktails. That never happened. The clientele basically comprises secretaries in skirts way too short for their figures, heels that they can't walk in, chunky tiffany jewellery, screaming 'Oh My God' to other tables, and married men looking for a quick hook up. Ok, that sounds bitchy, but it's accurate. Even sitting practically in each others' laps, we couldn't all have one conversation at the same time due to the said screaming going on from all all sides. It was like mating season in the monkey enclosure, where only the loudest and screachiest  were going to attract the male. The drinks were not good. Very expensive and just not brilliant ingredients. My favourite cocktail is a margarita and I can tell fake 'too sweet' lime juice a mile away - this was like drinking gummy bears. The cosmo my friend ordered had never seen a cranberry in its life and again had gummy bear lime juice. Even the views were a little disappointing, the best place to see them is the public picnic area on the opposite side of the roof to Madison. If you want to try this place (and assuming you are neither a screaming secretary, nor a philandering chap) I would recommend going earlier in the week. Actually scrap that, I wouldn't recommend going here at any time! (They get a point for clean loos. I do like a place that takes care of its nether regions.)

photos.caption: Photo of Madison - London, United Kingdom

jRkecmYhzDlDNZpM9hVAWA.text: I'm guessing a lot of people ordered the 'Hatorade' when they came here. I actually quite liked it. I dropped in after a session of yoga on the roof of One New Change. The terrace views of St.Pauls, the London Eye and the Shard are amazing - amazing date location. Inside it's floor to ceiling windows showcasing a panoramic view that must be awesome at night. Since it was a Sunday that I showed up, it was pretty quiet and I had my pick of seats. No crazy after-work crew like some of the other reviewers had to deal with. I had a glass of wine and some fries and soaked in the sun. The menu is a little on the pricey side for starters/tapas type dishes but the views make up for it. Only downside was the waiters are kinda strange and they brought me the wrong kind of fries.I like the bathrooms, they are large and very airy.

6-Wl55AerSr6ZrklvKDEiA.text: Even though I only dropped by for a drink and the view, Madison was purely breathtaking and worth a visit (whether a local or tourist). The service was good and the clientele was fun. This place has a great vibe.TIP: If you don't want to wait in the long line for the bar, then just take the express elevator to the roof deck only. You will NOT be disappointed.

t1RDzLRmqjIFRlg_NSgTTA.text: This place is great for drinks. The view from Madison is spectacular. We went here on a weekday evening for drinks. Seating for drinks is first come first serve. If you hang around for a bit you can get good spots to sit. Drinks are a little expensive but worth the view & ambience I would definitely recommend this place for drinks

h1nZrokHNf9QnEdr4vV69w.text: Some friends and I came here late one night. I was a little put off at first because they refused one of my friends for having trainers, but he actually had nicer shoes in his bag. Anyway, the initial vibe is one of... snooty just because there are bouncers that tell you to stand at a certain spot for the lift even when there isn't a line and who also make you change your shoes.  When we were up the lift we were met with a pretty cool view. The people around were already sufficiency drunk, but the place was quite incredible and the view was awesome. I would definitely come here during the day to try some of their food.

photos.caption: Photo of Madison - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Madison - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Madison - London, United Kingdom

Be1w3ISgU4fOcOCDtbBp7Q.text: Came here yesterday for lunch with a friend on the special lunch deal of two courses plus glass of wine for £20. The food choice on the set menu was excellent and I had the half a corn fed chicken which was huge and really tasty. My friend had the duck burger which came with fries (and the waitress suggested we share these to save me needing to order a side dish). Service was good and the desserts were delicious - I had orange polenta cake which I would definitely order again.  The wine list was good though the cheapest bottle of house was £25 and we chose a delicious rose at £28. The restaurant is on the roof of a modern building (6th floor) with a terrace and bar overlooking St Paul's cathedral. Magnificent views of London. We had coffee afterwards sitting on a sofa in the bar looking at the view. Really great place to enjoy lunch and London.

photos.caption: Photo of Madison - London, United Kingdom. View from Madison bar

Opzcw5KwJIs97X5uMhhn3Q.text: Words are not enough to described how fabulous is this lounge in the heart of city of London. Our friend recommended this place to meet for happy hour and dinner. The lounge and restaurant is on the roof top of the 1 New Change building having St. Paul's Cathedral as a backdrop, it was really breathtaking.The ambiance is trendy, the background music is just perfect for customers to have a conversation. They served gorgeous cocktails, although local beers and wine are available as well. We started our dinner with a shared Ravioli and Ox-tail fritters both appetizers are delicious. whilst I chosen Margret duck breast with roasted Jerusalem artichokes, black cabbage, soy and maple glaze as my main entrée. It was very filling, mouth watering and great paired with a glass of Cotes du Rhône.The wait staff are really awesome, they do have a fantastic customer service. We had a lovely time visiting London. I will definitely comeback here and would recommend this place to family and friends.

photos.caption: Photo of Madison - London, United Kingdom. Ravioli
Photo of Madison - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Madison - London, United Kingdom

ALM0I4P8KI2pG5e6CQZqpQ.text: Madison Bar is by far my favorite spot in all of London. It is a classy, yet laid back rooftop lounge that offers a breathtaking view of the London skyline, as well as the top of St. Paul's Cathedral Dome it is situated right across.You take a glass lift to the top floor of this lounge, and once you step outside, you're presented with a charming little area with tables, sofas, and a wider walking area where you can opt out on the alcohol and just enjoy the view. There's also food on offer but I've only tried the cocktails so far -- which were deliciously exotic by the way. They're not too strong, but that suits the chill atmosphere of the place. I'd recommend this lounge more for a date spot than a pre-drinks place to get yourself pumped for a crazy night out at the club.

0u-japqQQe6DrDK7k9yAvw.text: Great place to bring visitors to London. I took my friend to the bar on the rooftop at sunset and it was great. We were lucky enough to find a seat outside on a tall table where we could see St Paul's. Prices are on the more expensive side at around £8 a glass of wine, but when you have good views places think they can charge more, so I guess it is to be expected. It's a really pleasant venue though and would be great on a summers evening, but I expect it would get really busy. A lot of people just come up to the rooftop to see the views and take photos so there are quite a lot of people wondering around.

photos.caption: Photo of Madison - London, United Kingdom. And relax...
Photo of Madison - London, United Kingdom. Great views of St Paul's Cathedral

kqgkn_7DzhyeJXYhBQ6Z_Q.text: Go for the view  Plus good cocktails and chilled out atmosphere, great to impress and show London.

photos.caption: Photo of Madison - London, United Kingdom

WHLnnSXW4KnfGKGpTxYvUg.text: In terms of a bar, this venue is great, you have plenty of space , a bit less seating, and a fantastic view plus outside areas too. Slightly more expensive end but worth it.

DIAWoQUZKNG-igfhRhvGOg.text: Horrible experience. Literally everyone who works here and we spoke too was beyond rude. I will never be back. The deck is beautiful but skip the restaurant and bar they don't deserve your money.

924OvZsamXsJGhrF5rSgEg.text: Reallly awful over priced food and even worse service, the waiters and bouncers were rude and elitist. Would highly recommend Tamarind or Basuba much better service and food.

xVCz4JDjpST76BpuO2etiQ.text: Madison lived up to the reputation of having a nice view of the city, most notably St. Paul's Cathedral. However the best view is not actually from the bar but the free observation deck where you are not allowed to drink. It's a shame because there could be so much more room to enjoy the view. That said, it's a good spot to tick off your list if you're a tourist but the locals say that crowds are common and queues are unbearable. My experience was lucky coming just before the post-work rush and finding reasonable prices considering the location. I even managed to get a table although generally you will wait downstairs without a booking and can expect much more hassle on a sunny evening.I wouldn't be a regular here but then again, it was a nice place to go without a booking, as the popular Sky Garden was fully booked all week.

kjH_-Nt4D1Jq7Oij_c2QTA.text: Stopped in for a drink after work. The view was amazing. Especially when the sun went down. Very classy and upscale. Very busy when we went on a Tuesday. Drinks were a little pricey but not too bad. Would definitely go back for the view.

Kuv72mTIOfQh3nWjC5Qohw.text: It's hard to find a good roof terrace in Lonodon and while Madison doesn't have a view of the whole of London, the view it has of St Pauls cathedral is spectacular.It's a good place to take tourist friends visiting London for the first time and a good place to take a date as it's romantic overlooking the cathedral.However, if you are on a date, you may want to think carefully about what time you arrive as it's too epxensive to stay there all night. I suggest arriving early as it fills up toward the end of the night. Only groups can book tables on the terrace.The location inside One New Change  means you can start off your night with drinks, and go to Jamie Oliver or Gordon Ramsay's restaurant inside One New Change for dinner.

photos.caption: Photo of Madison - London, United Kingdom. Stunning backdrop
Photo of Madison - London, United Kingdom. Bubbles with a view

BaANmPzYmxJ9ing8-gaMMw.text: First time visiting here on a hot, sunny Sunday afternoon for cocktails on the terrace. The weather was perfect, got quite lucky. Nice, chillout catch up with a friend over drinks. Not too pretentious, found great seating near the terrace bar, what was even better, we got lounge service, which meant no queueing up! Was treating my friend to birthday drinks and chose The Rooftop - Hendrick's Gin, Elderflower, Lime & Prosecco. For myself I opted for Strawberr'Le - Belvedere Vodka, Limoncello, Strawberry, sugar and Prosecco. Amazing long drinks for an afternoon, warning though - they are pretty strong, so take your time drinking them. They went down pleasantly well.Round 2 we opted for the Pornstar Martinis - Vanilla Vodka, Passion Fruit, Lemon & Sugar, with a shot of prosecco. I have had a lot of these at various establishments, but these have got to my favourite at Madison's. They're not too overpowering, hydrating and even the prosecco is relatively light and enjoyable. The service is really good, drink suggestions from the mixologists are on point too. Was a perfect afternoon. Will definitely be visiting on more occasions. it has become my new favourite rooftop bar in London

photos.caption: Photo of Madison - London, United Kingdom. Porn Star Martinis
Photo of Madison - London, United Kingdom. Strawberr'Le & Rooftop

tvMaAvicoqDY2WlIfg_y7Q.text: As a bar, this place has tasty cocktails and an amazing view but really that's it (I can't yet comment on the restaurant). Booking an area requires a hefty deposit and without that there's not much space to stand, let alone sit.I have been a few times but I guess the last trip left a bitter taste in my mouth. We huddled on a bench area outside one evening at the end of April when the weather had been unseasonably cold having had hail earlier in the day. There were no heaters, only blankets.Friends arrived separately and it was ok until the last person tried to come up the lift and the door staff (at the lift entrance) refused to let him in citing no table reservation. With us already upstairs they then used the excuse of dress code (black leather trainers) which I think is a bit much for a bar on a Thursday night.With no other choice we finished our drinks and joined our friend. We moved on to The Happenstance where the drinks were cheaper and the staff really welcoming.

tWiETyvsRMmvBbAakZLGvg.text: This my new favourite watering hole near work. When the suns out there no place better, great vibe, great drink, great sounds, great foodIf you want to "hire" specific outside space they charge £1000 as a minimum spend for a group of 12 or more. Sounds expensive but for a group of about 20 it's only £50 each

photos.caption: Photo of Madison - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Madison - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Madison - London, United Kingdom

Q0DP8vcHC4tzf2n977wutQ.text: Madison has some clear pros and cons, though I'd give it four stars just for its unique pros. First, if you work in the Bank area, the location is perfect. In my case, this place is about 10min walk away from my office which makes it an ideal after-work venue for any purpose. Second, the view of St Paul's is one of a kind. Depending on the time of the day, you'll get different experiences too, so try to be there for a couple hours to see the full spectrum of the views this place can offer. However, a clear downside is the difficulty of getting in at peak times. For example, only two elevators operate up and down the building, and there can be a huge queue to even get on the lift to get to the bar. Once at the bar, you then have to go on a quest to find a spot to stand and drink amidst a heavy crowd. The drinks are good, though can be considered pricey. I liked their finger foods last time I tried. Finally, the indoors venue is quite well-done -- might be worth trying to get a table next time for a private party.

Yhz7EENusxUZkS3Fss3RWw.text: We found Madison's while walking through the area.  The views cant be beat, 6 floors up and across the street from St.Peter's cathedral.  They have many signature drinks.  Staff is very pleasant from the hostess, managing staff and servers.  Only issue, which was minor is the price.  But I thought it was worth it.

photos.caption: Photo of Madison - London, United Kingdom

tdhArj4rqo2a3_CGGOf36g.text: I really liked the view of the Madison, that's the first thing you notice when you take the elevator up to the 6th floor. The bar is quite expensive however, it costs around 10 pounds for a cocktail, and the line for the bar was fairly long but went kind of quick. There are areas to sit with laid back music to the left of the elevator. Go look at the view of The City before you grab a drink, since you can't bring your drink along with you on the main part of the rooftop.

photos.caption: Photo of Madison - London, United Kingdom. The view
